p:
Mortality rates (Table 3) were very low at 90% relative humidity; none of the
O. asellus
and very few of the
P. dilatatus
died at this relative humidity. The gradients of thermal reaction norms at 90% relative humidity were therefore not significantly different to zero. Under drier conditions, at 70% relative humidity, more individuals of both species died at 13.5 °C than at 18.5 °C, leading to steeper thermal reaction norms at 70% relative humidity than at 90% relative humidity.
